6:["$","section",null,{"className":"py-16","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"container mx-auto px-4","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"max-w-3xl mx-auto","children":[["$","h2",null,{"className":"text-3xl font-bold mb-6","children":["About ","Córdoba"]}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-muted-foreground text-lg leading-relaxed","children":"Córdoba is Argentina's best-kept secret for expats who want big-city amenities without Buenos Aires prices. The capital city is home to the oldest university in Argentina (founded 1613) and has evolved into a genuine tech hub with a young, dynamic population. The Sierras de Córdoba provide a dramatic backdrop — weekend hikes, artisan villages, and mountain retreats are all within an hour's drive. The city itself offers a compact, walkable downtown, excellent food (including the iconic 'lomito cordobés'), and a cultural scene that punches well above its weight. The local accent ('tonada cordobesa') takes some getting used to, but the warmth of the people is immediate."}]]}]}]}]
